articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Syrian Charge d'Affaires
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Syrian Charge d'Affaires
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Souheil Haidar, outgoing charge d'affaires ad interim of the Syrian embassy here, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets Cuban Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets Cuban Ambassador
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Jose Manuel Galego Montano, outgoing Cuban ambassador to the DPRK on Thursday.
					 Earlier, he met with Souheil Haidar, Syrian charge d'Affaires ad interim who paid a farewell call on him.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries and the China-Korea Friendship Association led by Wu Donghe, chairman of the China-Korea Friendship Association, visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace Thursday to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung.
					 They made deep bows to Kim Il Sung who made undying contribution to the strengthening of the DPRK-China friendship and the cause of global independence.
					
					 Wu Donghe made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Chinese Art Group Gives Performance in Locality of DPRK
articles.content:
Chinese Art Group Gives Performance in Locality of DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- An art group of dance drama "Confetti on Silk Road" of the Gansu Provincial Song and Dance Theatre of China on a visit to the DPRK gave its performance at the North Hwanghae Provincial Art Theatre in Sariwon City Thursday.
					 The performance was appreciated by Ri Won Il, chairman of the North Hwanghae Provincial People's Committee,  creators, artistes and media persons of the province and working people in the city.
					
					 The performers successfully represented the friendly feelings forged between the Chinese people and peoples of various countries along the silk road in the period of Tang Dynasty through virtuosity, graceful rhythms and perfect ensemble.
					
					 The performance was acclaimed by the spectators for its high artistry.

articles.title: IVF Coaching Course Held
articles.content:
IVF Coaching Course Held
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- A volleyball coaching course took place in Pyongyang recently according to a cooperation program of the International Volleyball Federation. 
					 The clinic, held at the Sports Science Library and Volleyball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street, was attended by volleyball coaches from sports teams and juvenile sports schools in the city. 
					
					 It dealt with basic training means and methods for improving physical and technical capacity of reserve volleyballers, as well as theoretical and practical matters arising in teaching volleyball technique.

articles.title: Three Principles of Korean Reunification
articles.content:
Three Principles of Korean Reunification 
						
Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il published a celebrated work "Let Us Struggle Resolutely to Implement the Three Principles of National Reunification" on July 14, Juche 61 (1972.)
					 At that time not only all the Koreans but governments, political parties and public organizations of other countries and international organizations fully supported the July 4 joint statement adopted between the north and the south of Korea, the keynote of which is the three principles of national reunification -- independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity.
					
					 But the then south Korean authorities, who had agreed with the three principles, changed their position. They arrested and even killed pro-reunification people, alleging that the U.S. forces in south Korea were not outside forces and that confrontation without dialogue turned into confrontation with dialogue.
					
					 By publishing the work, Kim Jong Il accused them of refusing to implement the joint statement. 
					
					 He also gave comprehensive answers to such theoretical and practical matters of implementing the three principles as taking substantial measures to relax the acute military situation and remove the source of a war on the Korean Peninsula and achieving great national unity, irrespective of difference in thought, ideology and social system. 
					
					 The three principles have displayed its great influence as guidelines for national reunification under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Through the effort for implementing the principles, pro-reunification organizations in the north, south and abroad have joined hands and conducted activities for the country's reunification. The Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification and the Pan-national Alliance of Youth and Students for Korea's Reunification were also formed. 
					
					 In particular, the June 15 joint declaration based on the three principles was adopted at the historic north-south summit in Pyongyang, the first of its kind since the division of Korea, to provide the nation with a landmark of reunification. 
					
					 The declaration ushered in a new era of reconciliation and cooperation between the two parts of Korea and led to the adoption of the October 4 declaration to be entailed by events signal in the north-south relations and in the effort for national reunification.
					
					 Now, however, the present south Korean regime is totally negating the three principles and joint declarations, while pursuing policies of pro-U.S. flunkeyism and confrontation with the north.

articles.title: Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (11)
articles.content:
Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (11)
Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- There is a "red agitator" on the Handre Plain where the socialist land of bliss is taking a shape. She is Om Jong Sil who is remembered by General Secretary Kim Jong Il and well known to the country.
					 She is an agitator at the Unhung Cooperative Farm, Thaechon County.
					
					 The leader met her in the field when he went to the farm in July Juche 97 (2008). He praised her for having worked heart and soul to increase the agricultural production after volunteering to work at the farm from Pyongyang and her parents for supporting and encouraging their daughter's determination.
					
					 He told her that she should become a model agitator and lead the masses as Ri Sin Ja did in the 1960s. Cherishing his trust deep in her mind, Om worked hard to produce more liquid manure and enrich the soil. She led her sub-workteam to over-fulfill its grain production plan every year.
					
					 She grew to be a model agitator under the care of the Workers' Party of Korea. To glorify the honor of a model farm of the country, she is stirring up the mental power of farmers in the van of the drive for increased grain production.

articles.title: Lapse of Six Decades since Establishment of Study-While-Working System Marked
articles.content:
Lapse of Six Decades since Establishment of Study-While-Working System Marked
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Six decades have passed since the study-while-working system was set up in the DPRK during the Fatherland Liberation War. Since then factory colleges under this system have trained a large number of native technicians, making big progress under the leadership of the party and the leader.
					 President Kim Il Sung visited an ordnance factory in Kunja-ri, Songchon County, South Phyongan Province early in 1951. Looking far into the future of the triumphant country, he advanced a unique policy on founding factory colleges for training native technicians.
					
					 According to the party's measures to massively set up colleges at big factories and enterprises as required by the developing reality, there appeared 23 factory colleges and seven branch colleges in the Juche 49 (1960)-Juche 50 (1961) academic year and the number of these colleges increased to more than 70 late in the 1970s and to over 100 in the 1980s, taking the country as a whole.
					
					 This led to the appearance of more than a hundred factory colleges, fisheries colleges and farm colleges. Hundreds of thousands of workers and farmers became engineers and assistant engineers while on the job. And hundreds of graduates emerged deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly and heroes.
					
					 Graduates and students of those colleges put forth hundreds of thousands of inventions and technical innovation proposals.
					
					 They played big roles in completion of UHP electric arc furnaces, the Juche iron production system, the mass-production of vinalon, a great event for the whole country, the gasification projects in Namhung and Hungnam and in the drive to put the country's industry on a CNC basis.
					
					 They hold an ever-increasing proportion in the technical and managerial staff of industrial establishments and farms. They play big roles in technological updating of the national economy, boosting production and in the drive to push back the frontiers of the latest science and technology.

articles.title: Papers Call for Implementing Three Principles of National Reunification
articles.content:
Papers Call for Implementing Three Principles of National Reunification 
						
Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Thursday dedicates a bylined article to the 39th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Struggle Resolutely to Implement the Three Principles of National Reunification".
					 The work indicates the clearest ways for applying the three principles of national reunification-- independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity--put forth by President Kim Il Sung in the overall movement for reunification. 
					
					 The article says: 
					
					 For the last nearly four decades the work has aroused warm support and sympathy from among all Koreans at home and abroad, instilling optimism about national reunification and conviction of sure victory among them and powerfully encouraging them in the patriotic movement for reunification. 
					
					 In the whole course of leading the movement for national reunification Kim Jong Il has adhered to the three principles of national reunification as a weapon for winning sure victory and wisely led the struggle to make sure that the issue of the inter-Korean relations and that of national reunification are settled strictly on these principles. 
					
					 Despite the persistent challenges and obstructive moves on the part of the separatist forces at home and abroad the reunification movement had gained in scope and strength as a nationwide one and there had taken place eye-catching events unprecedented in the history of the country's division after the advent of the June 15 era of reunification. This clearly proves the validity and vitality of the ideas, theories and policies set forth by Kim Jong Il in the work. 
					
					 The three principles of national reunification are the fundamental principles which allow no compromise under any circumstances. 
					
					 No one can replace the Koreans in the struggle for national reunification.
					
					 All Koreans who love the country and the nation and aspire after reunification and prosperity should turn out in a nationwide struggle against the anti-reunification forces, united close around the banner of the June 15 joint declaration irrespective of ideology, political view and ism. 
					
					 Minju Joson in a bylined article devoted to this day calls on all Koreans in the north and the south and overseas to bravely wage a nationwide struggle for fully implementing the north-south joint declarations on the basis of the three principles of national reunification.

articles.title: One More Soldier of S. Korean Puppet Army Commits Suicide
articles.content:
One More Soldier of S. Korean Puppet Army Commits Suicide
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- A soldier belonging to the 1st Division of the south Korean puppet Marine Corps present in Phohang, North Kyongsang Province committed suicide on July 10, south Korean MBC reported.
					 He destroyed himself, leaving his suicide note in which he wrote he could no longer endure savage violence by his superiors at ordinary times.
					
					 The recent suicide case which occurred in the wake of that reported on July 3 is a product of the inhuman treatment prevalent in the puppet army.

articles.title: S. Korean Prof. Chides US Poor Human Rights Record
articles.content:
S. Korean Prof. Chides US Poor Human Rights Record
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- A professor of south Korea recently posted on Internet paper Thongil News an article disclosing the poor human rights record in the U.S.
					 The number of those killed by others or committing suicide in the U.S. every year reaches tens of thousands and hundreds of thousands of persons are using drugs, the article said.
					
					 Recalling that 13 million persons are affected by various crimes, the article said the U.S. has the poorest human rights record as evidenced by the facts that nearly one million women are raped and millions of children are subject to violence, starvation and maltreatment. 
					
					 All these statistical figures are based on the objective data opened to the public by U.S. media, government reports, research data, etc., the article said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. is far removed from human rights norms as it is advocating "human rights" whenever an opportunity presents itself and arrogantly pulling up world people and interfering in the internal affairs of sovereign states under its pretext and resorting to all sorts of conspiratorial and false propaganda when they incur its displeasure.
					
					 Scathingly accusing the U.S. of talking about "human rights issue of the north", it said the U.S. is not qualified to say anything about human rights.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Hit for Firing Tear Liquid
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Hit for Firing Tear Liquid
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Public Health and Medical Organizations and the Pusan and South Kyongsang Provincial Consultative Council of Doctors for Humanitarianism on July 10 denounced the police for firing tear liquid at the participants in the action demanding vital rights.
					 The organizations accused the police of firing tear liquid containing carcinogen material and toxic gas substance at the protestors against the unreasonable lay-off by the business side around the Young Do Shipbuilding Yard of the Hanjin Heavy Industries Co. Ltd.
					
					 This tear liquid is highly likely to contain the same substance as what was used to crack down on the strike of the Trade Union of the Ssangryong Motor Co. Ltd., in 2009, they charged, terming the use of such tear liquid against the demonstrators who included even aged people and children an inhuman action.
					
					 Meanwhile, a photo showing police throwing out tear liquid on the road after putting down the demonstration was posted on an Internet homepage that day, stunning the people.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded by Foreign Personages
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded by Foreign Personages
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Personages of various countries made public statements on the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Abdul Wahab Rashwani, member of the Political Bureau of the Communist Party of Syria (Bagdash), in a statement on July 5 said the modern history of Korea would be unthinkable without President Kim Il Sung, adding that he was a benefactor of liberation as he freed the Korean people from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule. 
					
					 The secretary for international relations of the Communist Party of the People of Spain in a statement on July 7 noted the Juche idea founded by the President serves as a treasured sword for carving out the destiny of the people as it helped the working masses emerge a master of the world.
					
					 The secretary for international relations of the National Executive Committee of Socialist Party-Ample Front of Ecuador in a statement on July 5 praised Kim Il Sung for his immortal exploits performed in the human cause of independence.
					
					 John Jamit, chairman, and Jean-Pierre, secretary general of the Malta-Korea Friendship Association, in their joint statement on July 8 lauded Kim Il Sung as a benevolent father of the people who built a peculiar socialist system centered on the popular masses in Korea.
					
					 The chairman of the Finland-Mangyongdae Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung said in a statement on July 6 noted that the victory in the socialist revolution was one of the great exploits performed by him.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted by Peruvian Organization on Its Homepage
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted by Peruvian Organization on Its Homepage
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) – The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship on July 6 posted the full text of President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Step Up Socialist Construction under the Banner of Juche Idea" on its internet homepage.
					 The work, published on September 9, Juche 67(1978), clarifies the tasks for fully applying the Juche idea in state activities and energetically making the three revolutions, frustrating the "two Koreas" plot of the separatists at home and abroad and achieving the peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks facing the newly-emerging countries to get united and struggle against all forms of hegemony including imperialism.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated in Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Events were held in Indonesia and India from July 3 to 7 on the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung. They included remembrance meetings, book and photo exhibitions and film shows held by the Pioneer Party of Indonesia, the Indonesia-Korea Association for Friendship and Cultural Exchange, the Godwin Austen Company, the Rabitra Bahtera Pratama Co. and the Badja Machine Co. of Indonesia, the Indian Intellectuals' Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Indian Working Women Society for Study of the Juche Philosophy and the Sriralmahal Group of India. 
					On display in their venues were works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and books and photos on their exploits.
					
					 The participants of the film shows watched DPRK films "The Tower of the Juche Idea" and "Arms of Korea."
					
					 The general chairman of the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia said Kim Il Sung made a great contribution to the just cause of global independence against imperialism.
					
					 The chairman of the Indonesia-Korea Association for Friendship and Cultural Exchange recalled that Kim Il Sung established friendly relations with Indonesia together with President Sukarno, reiterating his will to set store by these ties and continue to boost them in the days ahead. 
					
					 The chairman of the Indian Intellectuals' Society for the Study of the Juche Idea noted that Kim Il Sung met political and public figures of many countries in the last period of his life and exerted all efforts to make sure that they steadily advance the cause of independence with firm faith in socialism, without giving it up halfway.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated by British Organizations
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated by British Organizations
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- British organizations released statements on July 7 on the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the Juche Idea Study Society of Britain in their joint statement praised President Kim Il Sung as a genius of revolution who founded the immortal Juche idea and a distinguished great man in the era of independence against imperialism.
					
					 The statement recalled that Kim Il Sung led the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK to hold higher the red flag even when the imperialists and international reactionaries and modern revisionists brought socialism to collapse in some countries and increased the pressure on DPRK.
					
					 It stressed that he would be always alive in the minds of the Koreans and the world Juche idea followers.
					
					 The British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association in a statement referred to the fact that Kim Il Sung led two revolutionary wars to victory. 
					
					 He was an outstanding thinker and theoretician and a great man of the century who conducted energetic activities for national reunification and the cause of global independence till the last moments of his life, it stressed.

articles.title: US Urged to Replace Korean Armistice Agreement with Peace Agreement
articles.content:
US Urged to Replace Korean Armistice Agreement with Peace Agreement
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The Oceanic Committee for Solidarity with the Peaceful Reunification of Korea issued a statement on the occasion of the month of international solidarity with the Korean people.
					 The statement recalled that the DPRK has always proposed the U.S. government to replace the armistice agreement with a peace agreement on the principles laid down in the agreement since it was concluded between the DPRK and the U.S. in the Korean Peninsula 58 years ago.
					
					 Despite the efforts of the DPRK government and people to sign a peace agreement the U.S. has persistently objected to it, pursuing a hostile policy toward the DPRK while keeping the U.S. forces equipped with nuclear weapons and military bases in south Korea, it noted.
					
					 The statement demanded the U.S. forces pull out of south Korea at once and the U.S. replace the Korean Armistice Agreement with a lasting peace agreement.
					
					 The said committee expressed belief that the Korean people would reunify the country under the banner of "By our nation itself" in accordance with the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, it stressed.

articles.title: Nepali Newspapers Laud Kim Il Sung's Feats
articles.content:
Nepali Newspapers Laud Kim Il Sung's Feats
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Nepali newspapers on July 7 and 8 gave special write-ups to the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The paper Majodur carried an article titled "Political idea of President Kim Il Sung" with a portrait of the smiling President.
					
					 The article noted that the President led the anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory to save the Korean people from the lot of colonial slavery and enforced all the democratic reforms to put forward the people as the master of the country.
					
					 He regarded the people as the best teacher and paid attention to their simple opinions and made sure that these views were adopted as policies of the Party and the state, it noted.
					
					 The paper introduced the undying feats of the President, the peerlessly great man who devoted himself to global independence.
					
					 The paper Arpan carried a photo of the President and an article entitled "President Kim Il Sung who always firmly believed in working class".
					
					 The article said that the President firmly believed in the workers and led the building of a new country, the Fatherland Liberation War, the postwar rehabilitation and construction and socialist construction to victory in reliance on them. He took warm care of their work and life, it added.

articles.title: Japan Plans to Introduce Early Warning Satellite
articles.content:
Japan Plans to Introduce Early Warning Satellite
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Japan is planning to introduce early warning satellite in a bid to intensify reconnaissance against other countries.
					 The government started the full-dress examination to introduce U.S.-made early warning satellite detecting any launch of ballistic missile, the Tokyo Shimbun said on Sunday.
					
					 The spending for satellite introduction would be included in the budget for fiscal year 2012, it noted.

articles.title: China Publishes White Paper to Mark 60th Anniversary of Tibet's Peaceful Liberation
articles.content:
China Publishes White Paper to Mark 60th Anniversary of Tibet's Peaceful Liberation
 Beijing, July 13 (KCNA) -- The Chinese government Monday published a white paper to mark the 60th anniversary of the peaceful liberation of Tibet.
					 The paper, released by the State Council's Information Office, reviewed the history of Tibet, particularly the liberation in 1951, as well as the Chinese nation's great struggle to defend the country's unification and sovereignty against imperialists' aggression over the past 60 years.
					
					 "Within six decades Tibet has achieved development that would normally call for a millennium. Under the leadership of the Communist Party of China and the Chinese government, the people of Tibet have created a miracle," it reads.

articles.title: China to Direct Efforts to Construction of Water Facilities
articles.content:
China to Direct Efforts to Construction of Water Facilities
 Beijing, July 13 (KCNA) -- Chinese President Hu Jintao stressed the need to direct efforts to the construction of water facilities, speaking at a meeting on the matter held in Beijing on July 8 and 9.
					 To step up the irrigation reform and development is an important and urgent strategic duty related to the drive for modernizing Chinese socialism and the long-term development of the Chinese nation and an urgent requirement for guaranteeing the nation's grain safety, he said.
					
					 Hu said China will establish a water system that utilizes water efficiently and protects water resources by 2020.

articles.title: China Sets Up First Higher Philosophical Institute
articles.content:
China Sets Up First Higher Philosophical Institute
						
 Beijing, July 13 (KCNA) -- China recently established the first higher philosophical institute in Beijing.
					 The institute was initiated by the Social Science Magazines and jointly set up by philosophical institutes and departments at 11 universities including Beijing University, Qinghua University and Chinese People's University and important research bases.
					
					 The institute will reportedly play a big role in developing the country's philosophy.

articles.title: China Launches Data Relay Satellite
articles.content:
China Launches Data Relay Satellite
 Beijing, July 13 (KCNA) -- China blasted off a new data relay satellite "Tianlian I-02" on Monday at the Xichang Satellite Launch Center.
					 The satellite was launched on a Long March-3C carrier rocket.
					
					 It is reportedly the country's second data relay satellite.

articles.title: New Express Highway Opens to Traffic in China
articles.content:
New Express Highway Opens to Traffic in China
 Beijing, July 13 (KCNA) -- The Hubei section of the express highway linking Hangzhou city, Zhejiang Province with Ruili County, Yunnan Province was completed recently in China. 
					 The completion of this project helped open to traffic the section of extending 3 405 km.
					
					 The express highway linking Zhejiang, Anhui, Jiangxi, Hubei, Hunan, Guizhou and Yunnan Provinces will contribute to speeding up the regional economic development.

articles.title: Exhibition on Theme of Revolutionary Traditions Held in China
articles.content:
Exhibition on Theme of Revolutionary Traditions Held in China 
 Beijing, July 13 (KCNA) -- An "exhibition on the theme of the revolutionary traditions in the central Soviet district -- let's display the revolutionary traditions and achieve greater success" was held at the State Museum of China from June 26 to July 9.
					 It was co-sponsored by the Jiangxi Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Museum of China to celebrate the 90th anniversary of the CPC and the 80th anniversary of the founding of the central revolutionary base and provisional central government of the Soviet Republic of China.
					
					 The exhibition was highly estimated by broad participants.

articles.title: Russia-Kazakhstan-China Motorway to Be Built
articles.content:
Russia-Kazakhstan-China Motorway to Be Built 
						
 Moscow, July 13 (KCNA) -- The vice-minister of Transport of Russia recently said a Russia-Kazakhstan-China motorway would be completed in about 2018. 
					 Its total length will be about 8,500km. 
					
					 The new trans-continental motorway would play a big role in hastening the process of integration among member nations of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, the vice-minister added.

articles.title: Russia Censures Resolution of European Parliament
articles.content:
Russia Censures Resolution of European Parliament
						
 Moscow, July 13 (KCNA) -- The first vice-chairman of the International Affairs Committee of the State Duma of Russia denounced a resolution of the European Parliament on the recent election in his country.
					 Shortly ago, the European Parliament adopted a resolution slandering the parliamentary and presidential elections in Russia, he said, adding that this assumed "prejudiced nature".
					
					 He noted that such an action taken by the European Parliament is related to the attempt of some political forces to use the election campaign circumstances in Russia and international organizations in meeting their purposes.

articles.title: Russia to Intensify Naval Force
articles.content:
Russia to Intensify Naval Force
 Moscow, July 13 (KCNA) -- Russia is directing steady efforts to intensifying the naval force. 
					 11356-type frigate ship Admiral Essen was recently launched at the Yantari Shipbuilding Yard.
					
					 The ship is to be attached to the Black Sea Fleet with mission to strike surface ships and submarines of the enemy.
					
					 It can beat back the enemy's air attack single-handedly or in coordination with other warships.

articles.title: Iran Calls for Foreign Warships Pullout from Persian Gulf
articles.content:
Iran Calls for Foreign Warships Pullout from Persian Gulf
						
 Tehran, July 13 (KCNA) -- The Aerospace Commander of the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) Amir Ali Hajizadeh called for the withdrawal of foreign warships from the Persian Gulf, local Mehr news agency reported on Sunday.
					 The Iranian commander said that regional nations do not need foreign forces' presence in the region and "they themselves can maintain the regional security and stability," said the report.

articles.title: Pakistani Army Rejects US Paper's False Report
articles.content:
Pakistani Army Rejects U.S. Paper's False Report
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Pakistani army on July 9 rejected the false report of the New York Times against his country.
					 The New York Times recently reported that the security organ and intelligence agency of the Pakistani army were involved in any terrorist attack, murder of a journalist, etc.
					
					 This is part of a calculated plan by "unnamed officials" to "weaken the state" and a direct attack on security organization and intelligence agencies of Pakistan, the spokesman said.
					
					 "The security organ and intelligence agency of the Pakistani army are strategic intelligence organizations, the first line of our defense," he added.

articles.title: Egypt Angry over EU Ban on Egyptian Seed Imports
articles.content:
Egypt Angry over EU Ban on Egyptian Seed Imports
						
 Cairo, July 13 (KCNA) -- Egypt was angry about the European Union temporary ban on importing seeds and crops from Egypt, according to a recent statement of Egypt's Ministry of Agriculture.
					 The unilateral measure ignored Egyptian and European tests which proved that the Egyptian fenugreek seeds were safe and free from E. coli bacteria, the statement said, adding that this affects the country's exports.

articles.title: CSTO Secretary on Gravity of Drug-related Crimes
articles.content:
CSTO Secretary on Gravity of Drug-related Crimes
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Nikolai Borzhzya, secretary of the Collective Security Treaty Organization, at a recent meeting referred to the seriousness of drug-related crimes.
					 Drug criminals actively use modern technical equipment and information and communication means, the secretary said, adding that illegal drug traffic still remains a serious issue to the member states of the Organization.
					
					 The secretary stressed the need to utilize to the maximum all possibilities within the Organization and further develop all systems to prevent escalation of drug deal as it is threatening the whole world.

articles.title: More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
articles.content:
More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- More NATO soldiers in Afghanistan met deaths.
					 Three NATO soldiers were killed by the attack of the resistance forces in the southern and eastern areas on Sunday.

articles.title: Global Renewable Energy Investment Increases
articles.content:
Global Renewable Energy Investment Increases 
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Global investment in renewable energy hit a record-high total of $211 billion in 2010, up 32 percent from the previous year's $160 billion, according to a recent report of the United Nations Environment Program.

articles.title: Food Crisis in Horn of Africa
articles.content:
Food Crisis in Horn of Africa
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- A food crisis is getting serious in the Horn of Africa.
					 Over 2 million young children in the Horn of Africa are malnourished, said UNICEF on Friday.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Indonesia, Tonga
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Indonesia, Tonga
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- A moderate earthquake measuring 5.7 on the Richter scale struck off Maluku Province in eastern part of Indonesia on Saturday.
					 The quake jolted with the epicenter at 146 km southeast of Ambon.
					
					 An earthquake measuring 5.6 on the Richter scale jolted Tonga on the same day.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia drama "Recordaremos el día de hoy"
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia drama "Recordaremos el día de hoy"
						
Pyongyang, 14 de julio (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comité de Defensa Nacional de la República Popular Democrática de Corea presenció el drama "Recordaremos el día de hoy" creada nuevamente por el Conjunto Dramático Nacional.
					El drama describe a los habitantes de un distrito montañoso quienes en el periodo de la marcha penosa levantaron con el indoblegable espíritu y el cordial amor a su tierra natal para materializar la orientación del partido de construir las centrales hidroeléctricas de mediano y pequeño tamaños.
					
					El Dirigente se mostró muy satisfecho ante el hecho de que los creadores y artistas del conjunto hayan creado el magnifico drama perfecto en lo ideo-artístico conforme a la demanda de la época del Songun manteniendo la teoría autóctona de drama lograda en el proceso de creación de 5 dramas revolucionarios y materializándola cabalmente en la práctica de la creación, evaluó altamente los éxitos de la función y les dio el agradecimiento especial a nombre del Secretario General del PTC, el Presidente del CDN y el Comandante Supremo del Ejército Popular de Corea.
					
					El drama es el mejor que aclaró en forma filosófica el recuerdo de la fe y la voluntad en lugar del recuerdo de la tristeza, señaló y volvió a evaluarlo como obra perfecta desde el establecimiento de las relaciones humanas hasta la dramaturgia, la estenografía, la música de efecto y las representaciones de interpretación y como otra obra maestra que representa la literatura y el arte de la época del Songun.
					
					Kim Jong Il se reunió con el escritor Kim Hung Gi y el director Jang Chan Guk y bendijo sus próximas actividades de creación apreciando altamente que ellos hayan creado la magnifica obra.
					
					Señaló que el drama revolucionario de Corea,  por su alto carácter ideo-artístico conveniente a la demanda y la aspiración de la nueva época sirve de una poderosa arma ideológica para formar a todos los miembros de la sociedad como los revolucionarios de tipo jucheano y transformar la toda la sociedad conforme a la demanda de la idea Juche y añadió que  es necesario mostrarlo mucho a los habitantes.
					
					Él se fotografió junto con todos los creadores y artistas del Conjunto Dramático Nacional.
					
					El drama "Recordaremos el día de hoy" puede ser un magnifico material didáctico que infunde en el corazón de las personas de la época del Songun la concepción revolucionaria de la vida y la del futuro, como la comedia ligera "Eco de la montaña", señaló y presentó las tareas programáticas que servirán de guía en la futura creación artística y  actividades de la función del Conjunto incluyendo el asunto de realizar ampliamente en la capital y las localidades las actividades de la función.
					
					Le acompañaron en presenciarlo Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comisión Militar Central del PTC, Kim Ki Nam y Choe Thae Bok, miembros del Buró Político y secretarios del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del Buró Político del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del Comité de Defensa Nacional, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su y Kim Phyong Hae, miembros suplentes del Buró Político y secretarios del CC del PTC, Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del Buró Político y secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del Comité del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del Buró Político y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, U Tong Chuk y Kim Chang Sop, miembros suplentes del BP del CC del PTC y otros funcionarios directivos de los órganos del partido y las fuerzas armadas y de las ramas de literatura y arte, prensa e información.

articles.title: Negociaciones Norte-Sur por el arreglo de propiedades inmuebles
articles.content:
Negociaciones Norte-Sur por el arreglo de propiedades inmuebles 
Pyongyang, 14 de julio (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el día 13 en el monte Kumgang las negociaciones entre los interesados del Norte y el Sur de Corea por el arreglo de las propiedades inmuebles de la parte Sur en la zona de ese monte. 
					En la ocasión la parte Norte informó el decreto del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la República Popular Democrática de Corea sobre el establecimiento de la zona especial del turismo internacional al monte Kumgang y el contenido de la ley sobre dicha zona especial y expuso la posición de la RPDC sobre el arreglo de propiedades inmuebles para ejecutarlo. Y propuso a la parte Sur optar por el turismo internacional o el alquiler o la venta. 
					
					En cuanto a ello, los relacionados con las autoridades de la parte Sur impidieron a los empresarios civiles a exponer sus posiciones y persistieron en que la ley sobre la zona especial del turismo internacional al monte Kumgang y el proyecto de arreglo de las propiedades inmuebles rompen el contrato entre los interesados y el acuerdo sobre los contratos e inversiones y que deben ser observados el derecho exclusivo de Hyundai y el acuerdo Norte-Sur. Además, presentaron las "tres condiciones" para la reanudación del turismo y la anulación de las medidas de confiscación y congelación de bienes inmuebles de la parte Sur, diciendo que "tomaría las medidas legales y diplomáticas". 
					
					Los empresarios civiles surcoreanos, que no son nada más que 3 hombres, no pudieron presentar sus opiniones por la presión de los relacionados con autoridades surcoreanas y lamentaron que no pueden participar en el turismo internacional sin permiso de las autoridades. 
					
					Los relacionados con autoridades de la parte Sur estorbaron también la consulta entre la parte Norte y los empresarios civiles surcoreanos. 
					
					La parte Norte recordó que el problema de arreglo de bienes inmuebles ocurrió por la suspensión unilateral del turismo por las autoridades surcoreanas y que durante los últimos 3 años la RPDC sufrió grandes pérdidas por el respecto y demandó a la parte Sur recompensarlo. 
					
					Puesto que la presente medida de la RPDC es para proteger el derecho a los bienes de los interesados surcoreanos, las autoridades de la parte Sur no deben estorbarlo, enfatizó la parte Norte. 
					
					Sin embargo, los relacionados con autoridades de la parte Sur persistieron hasta el final en su posición injusta impidiendo a los empresarios civiles expresar sus propias opiniones. 
					
					La parte Norte fustigó fuertemente esa actitud imprudente e insincera y aclaró que volverán a reunirse con los empresarios surcoreanos cuando ellos estudien más y tomen alguna decisión y que si la parte Sur no expone su posición hasta finales de julio, tratará en virtud de la ley los bienes inmuebles de la parte Sur, como ya ha declarado. 
					
					La parte Sur dijo que informaría al superior y anunciaría por vía adecuada la posición sobre el encuentro próximo.

articles.title: Periódicos celebran 39º aniversario de obra de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Periódicos celebran 39º aniversario de obra de Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 14 de julio (ATCC) -- El diario Rodong Sinmun insertó el día 14 un artículo individual dedicado al 39º aniversario de la publicación  de la obra del Dirigente Kim Jong Il "Luchemos resueltamente para materializar los Tres Principios de la Reunificación de la Patria".
					  La obra aclara el remedio más correcto que permite materializar cabalmente en todo el movimiento por la reunificación los Tres Principios de la Reunificación de la Patria presentados por el Presidente           Kim Il Sung: la independencia, la reunificación pacífica y la gran unidad nacional.
					
					Durante casi 40 años la obra causó el apoyo y la simpatía de todos los coreanos, les dio el optimismo y la invencible convicción en la reunificación y les estimuló al movimiento patriótico para la reunificación.
					
					  El Dirigente Kim Jong Il toma 3 Principios de la Reunificación de la Patria como la invencible arma en todo el proceso de su dirección y dirigió sabiamente a resolver los problemas de las relaciones Norte-Sur y de la reunificación de la patria basándose estrictamente en estos principios.
					
					  Pese al desafío atroz y a las maniobras  obstructoras de las fuerzas separatistas de interior y exterior, el movimiento por la reunificación de la patria se desarrolló a escala pannacional, y se abrió la época de la reunificación iniciada el 15 de junio.
					
					Estos eventos trascendentales sin precedentes en la historia de división de la nación demuestran claramente la justeza y la vitalidad de la idea, la teoría y la orientación presentadas en la obra del Dirigente.
					
					  dichos 3 Principios son principios fundamentales de la reunificación de la patria que no se pueden ceder en cualquier ocasión.
					
					  Nadie puede reemplazar la lucha de la nación coreana por la reunificación de la patria.
					
					  Los coreanos, que aman la patria y la nación y desean la reunificación y la prosperidad, deben levantarse en la lucha nacional contra las fuerzas anti-reunificación, unidos firmemente bajo la bandera del 15 de Junio por encima de las diferencias de ideologías, ideales, criterios políticos y doctrinas.
					
					  El periódico Minju Joson subraya a su vez que toda la nación del Norte, el Sur y en ultramar debe luchar a escala nacional por ejecutar cabalmente las declaraciones conjuntas N-S ateniéndose firmemente a los 3 Principios de la Reunificación de la Patria.

articles.title: Delegación china rinde homenaje a Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Delegación china rinde homenaje a Kim Il Sung
						
Pyongyang, 14 de julio (ATCC) -- La delegación de la Asociación de Amistad del Pueblo Chino con el Extranjero y la Asociación de Amistad China-Corea presidida por el titular de esta última, Wu Donghe, rindió el día 14 en el Palacio Memorial Kumsusan homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung quien hizo gran aporte al desarrollo de la amistad Corea-China y al cumplimiento de la causa de la independencia en el mundo. 
					El jefe de la delegación dejó en el libro de visitas las letras.
